section.title: Master-Details-Inspector Pattern
section.para: The master-details-inspector pattern is a window layout which contains the following panes:

listitem.para: the master pane in the left area of the window
the details pane in the center area of the window
the inspector pane in the right area of the window

section.para: A master pane is a control that displays a collection of objects, from which one can be selected.
A details pane is a control that displays the selected object from the master pane. The object can be structured, from which one or multiple sub-objects can be selected.
An inspector pane is a control that displays properties of the selected sub-objects in the details pane.
We can use the following design to implement this pattern with JavaFX:

listitem.para: For each component (master pane, detail pane, inspector pane) we create a FXML file for the layout, and a JavaFX controller class: MasterPaneController, DetailsPaneController, InspectorPaneController.
The MasterPaneController has a JavaFX ObservableList for the collection that it displays, and a JavaFX Property for the selected object
The DetailsPaneController has a JavaFX Property for the object that it displays and a JavaFX ObservableList for the selection of sub-objects.
The InspectorPaneController has a JavaFX property for the selection of objects for which it can display properties.
We bind the properties of the panes with JavaFX bindings.

section.para: This pattern can be altered in various ways:

listitem.para: The master pane can be omitted, which leaves us with a details-inspector pattern.
The inspector pane can be omitted, which leaves us with a master-details pattern.
the master pane can support multiple selection, which turns the object that is displayed in the details pane into a collection.
The inspector pane can only show the properties of the main object in the details pane instead from the selected sub-objects.
The inspector pane can show properties of the details pane itself.
The window can contain more than one inspector pane.
